results.title: The Canada cup: the ultimate series
results.creator_credit: James A. Cole and Bob Schulz Productions
results.brief_description: Through excerpts from several matches, interviews and commentary, the film attempts to show the excitement surrounding the Canada Cup for World ice hockey.

results.title: The Camera industry of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese cameras are world famous and eagerly sought after in the western world today. This film visits the factories and shows the methods used in the construction of various types of cameras which are exported all over the world.
results.description: Japanese cameras are world famous and eagerly sought after in the western world today. This film visits the factories and shows the methods used in the construction of various types of cameras which are exported all over the world.

results.title: The Call of Lourdes
results.brief_description: This film shows people from all around the world visiting the ‘city of miracles’ in the foothills of the Pyrenees. Amongst them are 40,000 of the old, the ill and the crippled who seek relief, if not a cure. The film shows the many pilgrims and tourists, the ceremonies, prayers, the grotto, the mineral springs with special properties and the great churches. Lourdes is the ‘city shrine’ to Saint Bernadette.

results.title: The Bugaku dance
results.brief_description: An introduction to “Bugaku” or Japanese Imperial Court dance and music, which have been preserved in the Imperial Court for centuries. It contains performances of “Ryoo”, a solo dance played with the use of masks, and “Bairo”, a mass dance. Music only - no narration.

results.title: The Broken wings = Lal Aghnihat el moutakasra
results.creator_credit: Yousef Malouf, Touric Kairouz and Touric Kairouz-Antoine Khoury
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, ‘The Broken Wings’ is adapted from Khalil Gibran’s (The Prophet) autobiography and made on location in Lebanon, set at the turn of the century. Writer and painter Gibran is introduced to Salma, only daughter of Sheikh Fares, a wealthy and influential aristocrat. Salma is a woman of ethereal beauty, a pure and noble soul and she and Gibran fall instantly in love. Their courtship is chaste and lengthy, watched over by Salma’s aunt as chaperone. A local bishop waylays the couple after convincing Fares that Salma should marry his nephew, Mansour Bey, a man from a reputable family but who is openly pursuing a relationship with another woman and acutely aware of the money he is marrying into. A disheartened Salma enters the loveless marriage, Gibran’s love increasing by the day. Tragedy ensues when Fares passes away, leaving his son in law to squander the family’s money and his daughter without protection. Bey is intent on Salma producing an heir. Sentimental and melodramatic, the film has a lyrical quality and strong performances that resonates long after viewing. All prints of the film vanished from circulation for many years, due to civil strife in Lebanon. After the surprise discovery of prints in an abandoned church outside of Beirut, the film was restored and reissued. Cast includes: Pierre Borday (Kahlil Gibran), Saladin Nader (Mansour Bey), Nidal Ashkar (Salma), Philip Akiki (Sheik Fares). In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: The Boy who heard music
results.creator_credit: Frank Le Flaguais and Les Productions Prisma Librefilms
results.brief_description: A whimsical story about a boy whose friendship with an old man brings a magic gift which enables the boy to play music on anything that looks like a keyboard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Le Flaguais and Les Productions Prisma Librefilms

results.title: The Boy and the pelican
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Gurnan, Arden Winch and Wessex Film Productions
results.brief_description: Pedro a pampered pelican lives happily on a Greek island until the arrival of a small boy called Hiko. Pedro is then forgotten by the islanders. He tries to fly away but is too bloated to succeed. On his return Pedro is seen by Niko who falls in love with him. Pedro is now completely happy.

results.title: The Borders: where Scotland and England meet
results.creator_credit: Mike Pavett, Robin Crichton and Edinburgh Film Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the agricultural and industrial development of the border regions of Scotland and England, and the growth of new houses and educational institutions. Highlights projects which have been implemented to attract population and encourage young people to stay instead of seeking careers and employment elsewhere.

results.title: Inland with McDouall Stuart
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Men of stamina”.
The first part of the film tells the story of Stuart’s three attempts, the last successful, to cross the continent from south to north. The second part describes today in the Northern Territory. A description of the country Stuart opened up suggesting that his prophecies are coming true.

results.title: The Blue mountains crossing - 1813
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Men of stamina”.
Takes the students from the original great journal of exploration by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson through to the present day development deriving from that exploration. No other credits available.
